data.text:
George Talbot, 9th Earl of Shrewsbury

M, #12341, b. 19 December 1566, d. 2 April 1630

Last Edited=16 Jun 2017

George Talbot, 9th Earl of Shrewsbury was born on 19 December 1566.1 He was the son of Sir John Talbot and Catherine Petre.1 He died on 2 April 1630 at age 63, unmarried.1

He was educated at Amiens, France.1 He was educated at Rouen, France.1 He was a Roman Catholic priest.1 He succeeded as the 9th Earl of Waterford [I., 1446] on 8 February 1617.1 He succeeded as the 9th Earl of Shrewsbury [E., 1442] on 8 February 1617.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3604. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

John Talbot1

M, #12342, d. 1607

Last Edited=16 Apr 2017

John Talbot was the son of Sir John Talbot and Catherine Petre.1 He married Eleanor Baskerville, daughter of Sir Thomas Baskerville.1 He died in 1607.1

He lived at Longford, Shropshire, England .1

Child of John Talbot and Eleanor Baskerville

John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury+1 b. c 1601, d. 8 Feb 1653/54

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3604. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Eleanor Baskerville1

F, #12343

Last Edited=16 Apr 2017

Eleanor Baskerville is the daughter of Sir Thomas Baskerville.1 She married John Talbot, son of Sir John Talbot and Catherine Petre.1

Her married name became Talbot.1

Child of Eleanor Baskerville and John Talbot

John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury+1 b. c 1601, d. 8 Feb 1653/54

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3604. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury1

M, #12344, b. circa 1601, d. 8 February 1653/54

Last Edited=16 Jun 2017

John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury was born circa 1601.1 He was the son of John Talbot and Eleanor Baskerville.1 He married, firstly, Mary Fortescue, daughter of Sir Francis Fortescue, before 1619.2,1 He married, secondly, Hon. Frances Arundell, daughter of Thomas Arundell, 1st Baron Arundell of Wardour and Anne Philipson, before 15 February 1647/48.3,1 He died on 8 February 1653/54.1

He succeeded as the 10th Earl of Shrewsbury [E., 1442] on 2 April 1630.1 He succeeded as the 10th Earl of Waterford [I., 1446] on 2 April 1630.1 A Royalist during the Civil War.1 In 1647 he had his estates sequestered by the Committee for Compunding.1

Children of John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury and Mary Fortescue

Lady Mary Talbot+2 d. c Mar 1710/11

George Talbot, Lord Talbot1 b. c 1620, d. 7 Mar 1642

Francis Talbot, 11th Earl of Shrewsbury+1 b. c 1623, d. 16 Mar 1667

Hon. Gilbert Talbot+1 b. c 1631, d. c 8 Apr 1702

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3604. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Hereinafter cited as The Complete Peerage.

[S21] L. G. Pine, The New Extinct Peerage 1884-1971: Containing Extinct, Abeyant, Dormant and Suspended Peerages With Genealogies and Arms (London, U.K.: Heraldry Today, 1972), page 10. Hereinafter cited as The New Extinct Peerage.

Mary Fortescue1

F, #12345

Last Edited=16 Jun 2017

Mary Fortescue is the daughter of Sir Francis Fortescue.1 She married John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury, son of John Talbot and Eleanor Baskerville, before 1619.1,2

From before 1619, her married name became Talbot.1 After her marriage, Mary Fortescue was styled as Countess of Shrewsbury on 2 April 1630.

Children of Mary Fortescue and John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury

Lady Mary Talbot+1 d. c Mar 1710/11

George Talbot, Lord Talbot2 b. c 1620, d. 7 Mar 1642

Francis Talbot, 11th Earl of Shrewsbury+2 b. c 1623, d. 16 Mar 1667

Hon. Gilbert Talbot+2 b. c 1631, d. c 8 Apr 1702

Citations

Hereinafter cited as The Complete Peerage.

George Talbot, Lord Talbot1

M, #12346, b. circa 1620, d. 7 March 1642

Last Edited=16 Jun 2017

George Talbot, Lord Talbot was born circa 1620.1 He was the son of John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury and Mary Fortescue.1 He married Mary Herbert, daughter of Percy Herbert, 2nd Baron Powis and Elizabeth Craven, in January 1639.1 He died on 7 March 1642, without issue.1

He was styled as Lord Talbot.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3604. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Francis Talbot, 11th Earl of Shrewsbury1

M, #12347, b. circa 1623, d. 16 March 1667

Last Edited=16 Jun 2017

Francis Talbot, 11th Earl of Shrewsbury was born circa 1623.1 He was the son of John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury and Mary Fortescue.1 He married, firstly, Anne Conyers, daughter of Sir John Conyers and Elizabeth Simeon.1 He married, secondly, Lady Anna Maria Brudenell, daughter of Robert Brudenell, 2nd Earl of Cardigan and Anne Savage, on 10 January 1658/59.1 He was murdered on 16 March 1667 by 2nd Duke of Buckingham, from a wound received in a duel with 2nd Duke of Buckingham.1

He gained the rank of Captain in the Royalist Army.1 He fought in the Battle of Worcester in 1651.1 He succeeded as the 11th Earl of Shrewsbury [E., 1442] on 8 February 1653/54.1 He succeeded as the 11th Earl of Waterford [I., 1446] on 8 February 1653/54.1 He held the office of Treasurer and Receiver-General of Ireland in 1661.1

Children of Francis Talbot, 11th Earl of Shrewsbury and Lady Anna Maria Brudenell

Charles Talbot, 1st and last Duke of Shrewsbury1 b. 24 Jul 1660, d. 1 Feb 1717/18

John Talbot2 b. 1664, d. 1686

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3604. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S3409] Caroline Maubois, "re: Penancoet Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 2 December 2008. Hereinafter cited as "re: Penancoet Family."

Hon. Gilbert Talbot1

M, #12348, b. circa 1631, d. circa 8 April 1702

Last Edited=16 Jun 2017

Hon. Gilbert Talbot was born circa 1631.1 He was the son of John Talbot, 10th Earl of Shrewsbury and Mary Fortescue.1 He married Jane Flatsburg.1 He died circa 8 April 1702.1 He was buried on 11 April 1702.1

Children of Hon. Gilbert Talbot and Jane Flatsburg

Hon. George Talbot+1 d. 12 Dec 1733

Gilbert Talbot, 13th Earl of Shrewsbury1 b. 11 Jan 1672/73, d. 22 Jul 1743

[S37] BP2003 volume 3, page 3604. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Brig.-Gen. Sir Charles Lyttelton, 3rd Bt.1

M, #12349, d. 2 May 1716

Last Edited=16 Feb 2011

Brig.-Gen. Sir Charles Lyttelton, 3rd Bt. was the son of Sir Thomas Lyttelton, 1st Bt. and Catherine Crompton.2 He married, firstly, Catherine Fairfax, daughter of Sir William Fairfax, before 1662.2 He married, secondly, Anne Temple, daughter of Thomas Temple, on 23 May 1666.2 He died on 2 May 1716.2

He held the office of Governor of Jamaica in 1663.2 He held the office of Governor of Harwich in 1667.2 He held the office of Governor of Sheerness in 1680.2 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) for Bewdley between 1685 and 1687.2 He succeeded as the 3rd Baronet Lyttelton [E., 1618] on 24 June 1693.2

Children of Brig.-Gen. Sir Charles Lyttelton, 3rd Bt. and Anne Temple

Sir Thomas Lyttelton, 4th Bt.+2 d. 14 Sep 1751

Charles Lyttelton2 d. 16 Aug 1712

Cary Lyttelton1 d. 18 Apr 1741

Mary Lyttelton3

Anne Lyttelton2

Citations
